text: Lucas Atkinson (born July 6, 1981) is an American politician. He is a member of the South Carolina House of Representatives from the 113th District, serving since 2016. He is a member of the Democratic party. ==Education and career== Atkinson attended Clemson University and graduated in 2004. He works as a consultant. ==South Carolina House of Representatives== ===2016=== After incumbent representative J. Wayne George decided to not seek re-election, Atkinson became a candidate for his seat in District 57. In the Democratic primary, he ran against two candidates, Lee Walter Jenkins Jr. and Ryan M. Waller. Atkinson won with 58.16% of the vote. In the general election, he defeated Republican Ethan Brown to win by 7,981 votes. ===2018=== Atkinson was unopposed in the Democratic primary and general election. ===2020=== In the Democratic primary held in June, Atkinson defeated Miko Pickett with 60.6% of the vote. He ran unopposed in the general election to win a third term. ===Committee assignments=== *Agriculture, Natural Resources & Environmental Affairs *Rules Committee ===Election history=== {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em ; font-size:95%" |+ District 57 - Dillon, Horry, and Marion Counties !|Year ! !|Candidate !|Votes !|Pct ! !|Candidate !|Votes !|Pct ! !|Candidate !|Votes !|Pct ! |- |2016 Primary | | | | align="right" | 4,489 | |58.16% | | | | align="right" | 1,796 | |23.27% | | | | align="right" | 1,433 | |18.57% | |- |2016 General | | | | align="right" | 10,172 | |80.66% | | | | align="right" |2,343 | |18.58% | |- |2018 Primary | | | | align="right" | | | | |- |2018 General | | | | align="right" |8,946 | |98.98% | |- |2020 Primary | | | | align="right" | 4,506 | |60.6% | | | | align="right" |2,933 | |39.4% | |- |2020 General | | | | align="right" | | | | |- |} ==References== Category:Living people Category:1981 births Category:Members of the South Carolina House of Representatives Category:South Carolina Democrats Category:21st-century American politicians
